# rotate(byDegrees:)

**Instance Method**

Rotates the view’s bounds rectangle by a specified degree value around the origin of the coordinate system, (0.0, 0.0).

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func rotate(byDegrees angle: CGFloat)
```

## Parameters

- **angle**: A `float` value specifying the angle of rotation, in degrees.

## Discussion

See the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/boundsRotation] method description for more information. This method neither redisplays the view nor marks it as needing display. You must do this yourself by calling the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/display()] method or setting the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/needsDisplay] property.

This method posts an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/boundsDidChangeNotification] to the default notification center if the view is configured to do so.

## Related Documentation

- **frameRotation**: The angle of rotation, measured in degrees, applied to the view’s frame rectangle relative to its superview’s coordinate system.
- **postsBoundsChangedNotifications**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view posts notifications when its bounds rectangle changes.

## Modifying the Coordinate System

- **translateOrigin(to:)**: Translates the view’s coordinate system so that its origin moves to a new location.
- **scaleUnitSquare(to:)**: Scales the view’s coordinate system so that the unit square scales to the specified dimensions.
